snippet: After the stock market crash of 2008 and a collapsing housing bubble diminished the value of many nest eggs, the cost of long-term care is now a concern for many aging Americans.
abstract: Cost of long-term care is now a concern for many aging Americans whose nest eggs have diminished since stock market crash of 2008; median annual rate for private room in nursing home in 2013 is $83,950; assisted-living facility's median national daily cost is $3,450 a month; 10,000 baby boomers are retiring every day for next 19 years; challenge is receiving attention from state and federal lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: After the stock market crash of 2008 and a collapsing housing bubble diminished the value of many nest eggs, the cost of long-term care is now a concern for many aging Americans.
